content:
The statement is not clear enough. "last 5 seconds"? How am I supposed to know how much time has passed since the last tic? How can the speed be 0 in the last test case even though the wheel must have turned to generate a tic?? Solving a clash shouldn't require players to guess what the author actually meant.

The proposed solution is NOT calculating the average speed for the last 5 seconds since it's looking at the first and last tic. They are not 5 seconds apart in the test cases!
Very complicated one for a clash :D
There is a probleme when len(buffer)=2. In this case buffer[-1]-buffer[1] = 0.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun puzzle

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice work ! Need some reflexion but easilly doable in 5min
This is a really good idea for a puzzle

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice job!

Hello,
It seems to me that to calculate speed, you have to use the perimeter and not the diameter of the wheel. The test results and the proposed solution are therefore missing a pi factor.

You could also supply the wheel perimeter instead of the diameter.

Best regards.

Goal section
* Please fix the following words:
   • emit => emits
   • turn => turned
   • the current => The current
   • keep => keeps
   • sec => seconds

* Suggest to change "round 1digit" to "rounded to 1 decimal place".

Input section
* Please format "N" in Line 3 as a [[variable]].

* Please change "separated [[t]]" to "[[t]] separated".

Output section
* Please change "sec" to "seconds".

* Suggest to change "round 1digit" to "rounded to 1 decimal place".

Thanks.

You are completely right,
I changed the parameter 'Diameter' description for 'Perimeter'.

You are right, there was an error in the solution,
It should be buffer[-1]-buffer[0]. There is no reason of ignoring first value.
I corrected the solution and expected value for each tests.

The latest test case is arguable. If there is only 1tic, the distance is 0 < D< 2*P.
in this case,  max speed= 2*P[m]*3.6/5 = 0.95 km/h.

Ofc there is not exactly 5seconds between last and first tic due to the sensor principle, but the statement indicate that only tics that occur during the last 5secondes are keep in the buffer.

But the statement does not say "calculate the average speed between first and last tic", it says "Calculate the average speed of bicycle in km/h for the last 5 seconds" which is simply not the case. It needs to be fixed.
I agree 100%. The statement needs to be worded a bit better.
